name: Introduction to Literary Theory and Criticism
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of literature through the theories and practices of literary criticism. It examines the different approaches to analyzing and interpreting literature, as well as the historical and social contexts in which these approaches were developed.

name: Contemporary Literary Theory
description: This course provides an introduction to contemporary literary theory, with an emphasis on its history, context, and application. The course examines the development of literary theory in the twentieth century and its implications for the study of literature.
prerequisites: Introduction to Literary Theory and Criticism

name: Advanced Literary Theory and Criticism
description: This course provides an in-depth exploration of the theoretical and methodological approaches to literary analysis and interpretation. The course examines the development of various critical approaches, such as structuralism, post-structuralism, feminism, psychoanalysis, and post-colonialism.
prerequisites: Introduction to Literary Theory and Criticism
